CREATE UNIQUE INDEX IND_BASE94 ON TAB94_BASE(COL2_BASE)

DROP TABLE TAB94_BASE

drop table tab311n_1

Test.Comment:
** for DB >= 7.4 without anonym constraints
renaming columns when creating a new table with create_table_as_select statement but trying to set a primary key by using the old column_names (see first run statement) ("LaSt_NaMe" <> lastname)

Statement.CallString: create table tab311n_1 (lastname char (50), firstname char(40), street char (60), city char (60), zip char(5), constraint tab311n_1 unique (lastname, firstname))
insert into tab311n_1 (lastname, firstname, city, zip) values ('Mueller', 'Holger', 'Berlin', 10445)
insert into tab311n_1 (lastname, firstname, city, zip) values ('Schmidt', 'Bernd', 'Berlin', 10375)
insert into tab311n_1 (lastname, firstname, city, zip) values ('Holtz', 'Werner', 'Berlin', 10653)

create table tab311n_2 (constraint constr311_uniq unique ("LaSt_NaMe", "FiRsT_nAmE" ), primary key (lastname, firstname)) as select lastname "LaSt_NaMe", firstname "FiRsT_nAmE", city, zip from tab311n_1
SELECT count(*) zero FROM DOMAIN.COLUMNS where tablename = 'tab311n_2'
drop table tab311n_1

Test.Comment:
** for DB >= 7.4 without anonym constraints
trying to define a foreign_key with ON DELETE SET NULL on a column which is also primary_key_column (but a primary_key_column is not allowed to be null)

Statement.CallString: create table tab314n_1 (lastname char (50), firstname char(40), street char (60), city char (60), zip char(5), constraint tab314n_1 unique (lastname, firstname))

create table tab314n_2 (constraint constr311_uniq unique (street, zip),
primary key ("LaSt_NaMe", "FiRsT_nAmE"), foreign key ("LaSt_NaMe", "FiRsT_nAmE") references tab314n_1 (lastname, firstname) on delete set null) as select lastname "LaSt_NaMe", firstname "FiRsT_nAmE", street, city, zip from tab314n_1

Error.ErrorMessage: [-7009] (at 136): NULL value in key column not allowed

Statement.CallString: SELECT count(*) zero FROM DOMAIN.COLUMNS where tablename = 'TAB314N_2'
drop table tab314n_1
